newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Millfeed demand perks up.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Millfeed demand perks up.

text.p: Demand for nearby millfeed has picked up in several locations across the U.S., several dealers said. Spot September values were steady to lower.

Nearby supplies are tight, one Tennessee dealer said. "I believe they will stay strong all winter long" due to high grain prices. Also, the mills are not expected to run longer than last year, the dealer stated.
In Texas, there were a few light trades, a Texas broker said. The Missouri market remains quiet but firm.
"We are seeing some (immediate) buying because of the downtimes on Monday," a northeastern broker said.
But he said he expects this to be temporary and that the balance of September will see normal mill output with a $3-$4 a ton discount.
Several dealers said millfeed demand has improved in the U.S. northern plains as producers feed more supplement to calves.
"Up north, a little more business is picking up, and in the south it is steady," one said.
